image.altText: An ASX share market digital board listing stocks in green and red lighting alongside the ASX logo

props.synopsis: The ASX has surged out of the blocks, climbing more than 6 per cent in early trade after US stocks rocketed higher on Donald Trump's tariff pause. The S&P 500 posted its biggest gain since 2008. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX leaps 4.5pc following Wall Street's gains on Trump tariff u-turn

image.altText: trump dinner

props.synopsis: The US president was confronted by a force far greater than his own and the office he now holds overnight. The bond market, an arena where brutality knows no bounds and where the participants take no prisoners.

title.children: Donald Trump ran into a brick wall and had no option but to back down

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands in front of flags of Australia and China.

props.synopsis: China's ambassador suggested Australia should stand in "solidarity" with China against tariffs, but Deputy PM Richard Marles said Australia would stand up for its own interests.

title.children: Marles says Australia will not 'join hands' with China against Trump

image.altText: A man in a suit sitting at a desk with a folder open before him

props.synopsis: Perched on one shoulder, the demons have been appealing to Donald Trump's long-held love of tariffs. On the other side, the angels have been appealing to his long-held love of deal-making.

title.children: As a trade war broke out in his inner circle, Trump blinked on tariffs

image.altText: Man in a suit speaking into a microphone behind a podium while holding up a chart

props.synopsis: Amid fears that the so-called reciprocal tariffs could cause a recession for the US, here's what it means for the global economy.

title.children: US President Trump pauses most 'reciprocal' tariffs. What we know

image.altText: Untitled Photo - 2025-04-10 12:52:34

props.synopsis: Energy Minister Chris Bowen and his Coalition counterpart Ted O'Brien go head-to-head in a debate at the National Press Club. Follow live.

title.children: 'More detail in a Chinese menu': Energy ministers clash in first debate

image.altText: School girls carry signs including 'Cool People don't deserve a warm planet', students march behind them.

props.synopsis: Shadow energy minister Ted O'Brien said climate targets would be reviewed under a Coalition government, with an eye to protecting economic growth.

title.children: Coalition keeps open option of quitting Paris climate agreement

image.altText: A man in a navy suit

props.synopsis: Saul Eslake said the proposal to set aside mining windfalls in a fund to pay down future debt was "shuffling money around", but Angus Taylor said it would create a "lasting national asset".

title.children: Angus Taylor's new debt fund is a 'gimmick', says prominent economist

image.altText: The tail of a Virgin Australia plane on the tarmac, with other planes lines up behind it.

props.synopsis: Customers were overcharged when changes were made to their itineraries, according to a spokesperson from Virgin Australia.

title.children: 'We sincerely apologise': Virgin to refund 61,000 overcharged customers

image.altText: The Māori Party caucus after the protest inside the chamber.

props.synopsis: New Zealand's Treaty Principles Bill has been voted down in the country's parliament, killing off the controversial piece of proposed legislation.

title.children: NZ Treaty bill defeated: 'We had two choices — to live or to die'

image.altText: The Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge just after sunset.

props.synopsis: Since last August, Australia has baked through above-average temperatures and the BOM is predicting another winter of unseasonable heat.

title.children: BOM predicts one of the warmest winters on record

image.altText: A freestanding Victorian-era house painted white with black wrought iron balustrades on the lefthand side

props.synopsis: What would you risk for the house of your dreams? That's the question Melbourne couple Stephanie and Paul Ryan grappled with when the opportunity arose to buy a rundown Victorian-era house that's under the threat of compulsory acquisition.

title.children: Couple's gamble on forever home at risk of compulsory acquisition

props.synopsis: Police are investigating an alleged assault on a beach on the Sunshine Coast that left a 60-year-old woman with broken ribs, spinal fractures, a fractured ankle, and a lacerated liver.

title.children: Woman suffers spinal injuries after dog owner 'rugby tackle' on beach

image.altText: A bald man.

props.synopsis: The leader of a far-right neo-Nazi group has failed in his efforts to get the court to remove a 'radical' bail condition barring him from communicating with other members of the group.

title.children: Neo-Nazi leader tells court bail is 'impinging' his 'fundamental rights'

image.altText: Leah O'Brien after breaking U18 national record.

props.synopsis: Breaking a national record held by Raelene Boyle is no mean feat, so it's little surprise 17-year-old Leah O'Brien is still coming to terms with what she has achieved.

title.children: Perth teen sprinter still in 'shock' after breaking 57-year national record

image.altText: The number "2073" emblazoned across what looks like a human-made tunnel.

props.synopsis: With journalists struggling to get people to take warnings about climate change and fascism seriously, a filmmaker stepped in. 2073 combines dystopian fiction with real-life footage from the world right now to send an important message.

title.children: Shocking scenes make up dystopian film 2073, using real-life footage

image.altText: An aerial photograph shows a sprawling mix of pink and beige buildings and palm trees on a beachfront property.

props.synopsis: As countries and markets grapple with the ongoing fallout from his tariff policy, some are wondering if Donald Trump has a bigger plan to overhaul global trade and reset America's industrial economy.

title.children: What is Trump up to? The so-called 'Mar-A-Lago Accord' could be a clue

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds his arms out while speaking at a Sky News leaders' debate

props.synopsis: The third week on the campaign trail will be critical, before the Easter break and the commencement of early voting, and polls suggest the contest remains tight.

title.children: US admits 'running up the score' with Australia, leaving little room for deals

image.altText: A woman in a royal blue sequin dress with a large peacock-like plumage, stands above a colour saturated cliff

props.synopsis: Kiri Pritchard-McLean has had to keep her stand-up career very separate from her life as a foster carer. But now she can bring the two together, with hilarious results.

title.children: This comedian wants to show the funny side of foster caring

image.altText: Workers

props.synopsis: Six people contracted the infectious disease after spending time in Sydney's CBD over the past three weeks, according to NSW Health.

title.children: Health warning for people who have been in Sydney CBD over past 10 days

image.altText: A boa constrictor large snake slithering along a footpath near a bridge on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: The large snake was spotted slithering down a footpath onto sand near a Sylvania bridge in Sydney's south, about 10km from the airport.

title.children: Boa constrictor snake on the loose 10km from Sydney airport, locals on alert

image.altText: A woman with a shaved head reaches out at a woman carrying a toddler, who both have their faces blurred.

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old woman who randomly attacked a toddler and an elderly woman in separate assaults in Perth is jailed for 18 months.

title.children: 'Out of control': Perth woman jailed for assaults on toddler, elderly woman

image.altText: Wide aerial shot of Alice Springs street with bush and mountains in background

props.synopsis: A Danish tourist has left Alice Springs after she was punched and stomped on in an unprovoked attack, just hours after she arrived in town. A man has been charged over the incident.

title.children: Danish tourist knocked out in unprovoked attack leaves Alice Springs

image.altText: A worker checks cable connection on a solar panel at a solar farm

props.synopsis: While experts weigh in on the great energy debate, one builder says the industry has already made up its mind.

title.children: In the debate between renewables and nuclear, some say it's 'game over'

image.altText: A young mother sitting on a couch with a smiling toddler lying across her lap

props.synopsis: New research shows educational disadvantage begins when children are as young as two if they cannot access child care. With about one-quarter of the country living in "childcare deserts", experts are demanding more from both parties.

title.children: Study reveals missing out on child care as a toddler can put you behind for years

image.altText: A woman wearing a red t shirt and black glasses stands across the road from Westfield Bondi Junction

props.synopsis: Survivors say they are still breaking down and deeply traumatised by the stabbing attack on April 13, 2024 at Westfield Bondi Junction that killed six people.

title.children: 'I still have nightmares': The high price paid by Bondi stabbing witnesses

image.altText: Cathy crouched down with her chooks

props.synopsis: With egg shortages expected to last several years, demand for backyard chickens is soaring. Here's what you need to know before adopting some for yourself.

title.children: Considering adopting chickens in the egg shortage? Read this first

image.altText: Cracked and damaged road with asphalt that falls away to become a gravel shoulder, with a 100 kilometre an hour sign amid trees

props.synopsis: The Coalition has promised to improve access to health care and child care in the regions, boost connectivity and improve roads with a $20 billion future fund.

title.children: Coalition pledges $20b regional fund for 'forgotten Australians'

image.altText: A student receives a measles vaccine injection at the Ecole Polytechnique Federale de Lausanne (EPFL).

props.synopsis: Australia is in the middle of a surge in measles cases amid a global spike and declining childhood vaccination rates. So what precautions should be taken to avoid widespread transmission?

title.children: Doctors warn of travel risks as measles cases surge in Australia

image.altText: Kim Birrell plays a shot

props.synopsis: Australia loses its Billie Jean King Cup clash against Kazakhstan after Kim Birrell and Maya Joint both drop their singles rubbers at the Queensland Tennis Centre in Brisbane.

title.children: Aussies lose BJK Cup clash with Kazakhstan after stirring comeback

image.altText: Sonia Ballal stands out the front of her house.

props.synopsis: Victoria's building regulator has warned consumers it is investigating a builder over allegations it has built potentially unsafe homes in Melbourne's outer suburbs.

title.children: Watchdog sounds alarm on Melbourne builder's 'defective work'

image.altText: Lady standing in front of media

props.synopsis: Housing Minister Clare O'Neil is seeking to keep approving development projects ahead of the election regardless of the government being in caretaker mode, but the Coalition has heavily criticised the request.

title.children: Labor wants to break election rules to approve housing applications

image.altText: a large wavy sculpture outside the brisbane court precinct in the sunshine

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Childrens Court heard the teenager allegedly researched bomb making instructions and purchased explosives ingredients.

title.children: Teen accused of terror plot allegedly tested homemade explosives

image.altText: A man wearing a black denim jacket standing in front of a body of water

props.synopsis: An election candidate's acknowledgement of his criminal past has prompted questions over whether a section of Australia's Constitution should be updated.

title.children: Would you trust a person convicted for fraud to represent you in parliament?

image.altText: Fallow deer roaming in bush land.

props.synopsis: A project to rehabilitate wetlands in Tasmania has been going since the 80s. It keeps getting destroyed by deer — and the community group involved has had enough.

title.children: Decades of work lost to feral deer — and this group is sick of it
